dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4950 IH: Data Broadband Reporting and Integration for Deployment in Geographically Essential Areas Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Houchin (for herself, Ms. Kelly of Illinois, Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania, Mr. Sorensen, Mr. Nunn of Iowa, Mr. Costa, Mr. Smith of Nebraska, and Mr. Soto) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To direct the Federal Communications Commission to incorporate into the National Broadband Map of the Commission a layer that presents data on the location of agricultural areas, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Data Broadband Reporting and Integration for Deployment in Geographically Essential Areas Act or the Data BRIDGE Act.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Commission shall update (and thereafter maintain) the map described in section 802(c)(1)(A) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 642(c)(1)(A)) in a manner that incorporates, as a layer of such map, data on the location of agricultural areas.
In carrying out this section, the Commission shall consult withâ€”

paragraph.text: the Secretary of Agriculture, including with respect to existing data of the Department of Agriculture related to the location of agricultural areas;
the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information;
representatives of other relevant stakeholders (as determined appropriate by the Commission).
The term Commission means the Federal Communications Commission.
The term State means each of the several States and the District of Columbia.
